question:
With respect to Federal parliament of Nepal, which of the following is / are correct statement(s)?
  1. It provides for a bi-cameral Parliament made of National Assembly as lower house and National Council as upper house
  2. The lower house of Federal parliament of Nepal is a 275 member body
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: The new Constitution provides for a bi-cameral Parliament — a 275 member House of Representatives (Pratinidhi Sabha), of which 165 are directly elected on a ‘first past the post’ (FPTP) system and 110 on the basis of ‘proportional representation’ (PR); and a 59-member National Assembly (NA) (Rashtriya Sabha) consisting of eight members indirectly elected from each of the seven provinces and three nominated members.
